text.0: what deed hath indra done in the wild transport in quaffing or in friendship with the soma.
text.1: what joys have men of ancient times or recent obtained within the chamber of libation.
text.2: in its wild joy indra hath proved him faithful faithful in quaffing faithful in its friendship.
text.3: his truth is the delight that in this chamber the men of old and recent times have tasted.
text.4: all thy vast power o maghavan we know not know not the riches of thy full abundance.
text.5: no one hath seen that might of thine productive of bounty every day renewed o indra.
text.6: this one great power of thine our eyes have witnessed wherewith thou slewest varasikhas children.
text.7: when by the force of thy descending thunder at the mere solund their boldest was demolished.
text.8: in aid of abhyavartin cayamana indra destroyed the seed of varasikha.
text.9: at hariyupiya he smote the vanguard of the vrcivans and the rear fled frighted.
text.10: three thousand mailed in quest of fame together on the yavyavati o muchsought indra.
text.11: vrcivans sons falling before the arrow like bursting vessels went to their destruction.
text.12: he whose two red steers seeking goodly pasture plying their tongues move on twixt earth and heaven.
text.13: gave turvaśa to sṛñjaya and to aid him gave the vrcivans up to daivavata.
text.14: two wagonteams with damsels twenty oxen o agni abhydvartin cayamdna.
text.15: the liberal sovran giveth me this guerdon of prthus seed is hard to win from others.
